competenciasEspecificas: 1. Critically assess linguistic and cultural diversity and adapt to it based on the plurilingual, pluricultural and intercultural reality, reflecting on the similarities and differences between their languages and the main dialect varieties, and sharing the different cultural characteristics, to promote language transfer, combat linguistic stereotypes and prejudices and value this diversity as a source of cultural wealth.

2. Understand and interpret oral and multimodal texts in standard language by identifying main and secondary ideas, and basic plot lines, assessing the reliability of sources and making use of strategies of inference and verification of meanings, to build knowledge, form an opinion and critically broaden the possibilities of enjoyment and leisure.

3. Produce oral and multimodal texts with appropriate coherence, clarity and register, attending to the conventions of the different discursive genres, and participate in varied oral interactions actively and spontaneously, and with sufficient fluency and precision, to express ideas , feelings and concepts, build knowledge and establish personal bonds.

4. Understand, interpret and value, with a critical sense and different reading purposes, written and multimodal texts, recognizing the main ideas and plot lines, integrating the explicit information, identifying and inferring the intention of the issuer, reflecting on the content and form and evaluating its quality and reliability in order to build knowledge and respond to diverse communicative needs and interests.

5. Produce written and multimodal texts with adequacy, coherence, cohesion and correction, with peer regulation and autonomous self-regulation, and attending to the conventions of the chosen discursive genre, to build knowledge and respond in an informed, effective and creative way to purposes specific communications.

6. Select, compare and infer information from different sources autonomously, evaluating its reliability and relevance based on the reading objectives and avoiding the risks of manipulation and misinformation, and integrate this information and transform it into knowledge to communicate it, adopting a critical and personal point of view while respecting intellectual property, especially in the context of carrying out research work on subjects in the curriculum or linked to the literary works read.

7. Independently select and read relevant works of literature in a foreign language as a source of pleasure and knowledge, setting up a reading itinerary that is progressively enriched in terms of diversity, complexity and quality of the works, and share reading experiences to build your own reading identity and enjoy the social dimension of reading.

8. Mediate between different languages or dialect varieties, using effective strategies and knowledge aimed at explaining, reformulating concepts and opinions or simplifying messages autonomously, to transmit information in an efficient, clear and responsible manner, and to create a positive atmosphere that facilitates the understanding.

9. Expand and use personal linguistic repertoires between different languages and dialect varieties, reflecting critically on their functioning, and making explicit and sharing their own strategies and knowledge, to improve the response to communicative needs and to favor the learning new languages.

10. Put communicative practices at the service of democratic coexistence, the dialogic resolution of conflicts and the equal rights of all people, using non-discriminatory language and rejecting abuses of power through the word to promote an effective use , ethical and democratic language.
